thread.section_title: Sports - Sault Ste. Marie Evening News - Sault Ste. Marie, MI
thread.title: Blue Devils spike Bays

author: Staff reports
title: Blue Devils spike Bays
text: Staff reports Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 10:28 AM By Staff reports Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 10:28 AM BRIMLEY—The Sault High volleyball team followed up a runner-up finish at the Escanaba Invitational over the weekend by beating Brimley 3-0 Monday night. The Blue Devils dropped the Bays 25-14, 25-11, 25-20. Brenna James turned in 21 digs and Jacki Sanderson had 21 assists for the Blue Devils. Cece Werner hit 11 kills and added five blocks, while Val Gage had seven kills and five blocks. Jordan Menard added three kills and seven digs, Maddi Misiak tacked on three kills and 10 digs, Ella Rechner had five kills, and Kelsie Sibbald had three kills and seven assists. Sault High went undefeated in pool play at the 10-team Escanaba tournament Saturday, before falling against Marquette 25-21, 25-20 in the final match. The Blue Devils stopped the host Escanaba Eskymos 23-25, 25-17, 15-11 in the semifinals. For the tournament, Werner delivered 57 kills, 11 blocks and 53 digs, while James added 74 digs. Sanderson had 104 assists and 29 digs, while Misiak had 21 kills and 43 digs. Menard added 16 kills and 16 digs, while Gage had 13 kills and six digs. Sibbald added nine assists, Ella Rechner had six kills and four blocks, and Annie Mclean had 13 digs. “I was very pleased on our day,” Sault High coach Lisa Moran said. “Going undefeated all day is something to be proud of. It was a really nice tournament and fun to play teams we don't normally see. “Cece played great all day,” Moran said. “She definitely stood out in the tournament and they had a tough time stopping her all day. Jacki Sanderson did a good job setting and Brenna James stood out defensively. She was all over the court.” JV volleyball, Sault 3, Brimley 0: The Sault JVs beat Brimley 25-12, 25-19, 15-5 Monday night. Katja Wilhelms dealt out 19 assists and had six digs, six aces and two kills. Maddie Fitzpatrick added 11 digs, Kristen LaPrade added three kills, two digs and one ace, while Ashtyn Bell had 11 kills, two digs and one block. By Staff reports   Staff reports
